notesStmt.note: Title supplied by cataloger; title for book on printed title page (p. 1) is Tōn tēs Hellados exochōn rhētorōn Aischinou kai Dēmosthenous logoi antipaloi.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Two student texts of the Attic orators Demosthenes and Aeschines from the prosecution of Athenian orator Ctesiphon, edited by German humanist Johann Reuchlin, published in Paris by Christian Wechel in 1543, together with an edition of Isocrates' Encomium Helenae published in Paris by Joannes Lodoicus (Jean Loys) in 1538. 64 pages of Demosthenes's oration On the crown have extensive interlinear annotations in Latin and marginal annotations in Greek. The opening of the Helen is annotated in the same manner.
msContents.textLang: Greek, with Greek and Latin annotations

msItem.title: Peri staseo?s tou kata Kte?sipho?ntos logou, p. 1
Aibaniou hupothesis tou peri tou stephanou logou, p. 77
De?mosthenous ho peri tou stephanou logos, p. 79

supportDesc.extent: 90 leaves : 231 x 166 (168 x 91) mm. bound to 232 x 167 mm

collation.p: Paper, 90; 1-19⁴ 20⁶ 21-22⁴; [1], 2-162, [163-180]; contemporary printed pagination, modern pagination in pencil, upper outer corners.

decoDesc.decoNote: Reused manuscript leaf, Inside front cover
Reused manuscript leaf, Inside back cover

binding.p: Contract in Latin on parchment, lacking beginning, probably in a French hand (Martayan Lan).

history.provenance: Formerly owned by Giuliano Attilio Piovano (bookplate on verso of vellum reinforcement, G. A. Piovano, with motto Panta kai ouden, and inscription "All' amico Piovano con franca amicizia, [G. Vitalis?], Torino, XXII Settembre del MCMXII, p. 180).
